summary: This is an email chain from August 16, 2019, regarding final logistical details for an upcoming U.S. Bureau of Prisons (BOP) Executive Staff Meeting in Washington, D.C. The primary topics are a revised agenda to include briefings for a new ODAG (Office of the Deputy Attorney General) Liaison, and the cancellation of travel to Philadelphia with instructions for the Washington meeting.

persons.name: BOP-PRD/Assistant Director
persons.role: Bureau of Prisons Program Review Division Assistant Director
persons.context: The sender of the initial email advising the Executive Staff of a revised agenda to include briefings for a new ODAG Liaison.

events.title: Executive Staff Briefings to ODAG
events.description: A scheduled briefing session for the Bureau of Prisons Executive Staff to present to a new ODAG (Office of the Deputy Attorney General) Liaison.

events.title: August 2019 Executive Staff Meeting
events.description: A multi-day executive staff meeting for the Bureau of Prisons, relocated from Philadelphia to Washington, D.C.

locations: Hyatt Regency Washington on Capitol Hill
keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons Executive Staff meeting scheduled for August 2019 was moved from Philadelphia to Washington, D.C.
A key agenda item was a 2-hour briefing session for a new ODAG (Office of the Deputy Attorney General) Liaison scheduled for August 20, 2019.
The email references a previous comprehensive briefing book from April 2019, indicating ongoing liaison and reporting duties between the BOP and the Deputy Attorney General's office.
The document shows standard government meeting logistics (agenda, dress code, security access with PIV cards) being coordinated just days before the meeting.
